models.Domain: An available domain/expertise area that can be selected when building an agent. Each domain has a schema that defines the form fields for configuration and may enable specific tools when selected.
models.SchemaField: A single form field definition within a domain's schema, defining the type, label, validation rules, default value, and tools that become available when this field has a value.
models.AgentConfig: A saved agent configuration containing the selected domains, filled form values, enabled tools, and optional empty fields for runtime configuration.
models.AgentTemplate: A saved agent configuration that can be reused as a starting point for new agents.
models.Tool: A function-calling capability that can be enabled for an agent, either automatically from field selections or manually from the tool library.
models.ToolLibrary: A collection of available tools that can be searched, configured, and added to an agent.
models.EnabledToolMapping: Shows which tools are enabled and which form field or manual selection caused them to be enabled.
models.PromptPreview: A live-generated preview of the system prompt assembled from the selected domains and form values.

relationships: Domain has many SchemaFields (defined by its schema)
SchemaField may have many Tools that become available when the field is filled
AgentConfig has many form field values corresponding to the schemas of selected domains
AgentConfig has many EnabledTools (from field mappings and manual selections)
AgentConfig may have EmptyFields that are enabled for runtime configuration
EnabledToolMapping maps Tools to the SchemaField or manual selection that enabled them
PromptPreview is generated from AgentConfig by combining domain templates with form values

domains.name: Cybersecurity
domains.description: Security assessment, vulnerability analysis, and threat detection expertise

fields.label: Assessment Scope
fields.placeholder: Describe the systems, networks, or assets to be assessed...

domains.template: You are a cybersecurity specialist focused on {{scope}}. Assess findings against {{complianceStandards}} standards. Report findings at {{severityThreshold}} severity level and above. Format output as {{reportFormat}}.

domains.name: Cloud Architecture
domains.description: AWS, Azure, and GCP infrastructure design and optimization

fields.label: Scaling Requirements
fields.placeholder: Describe expected traffic patterns and scaling needs...

domains.template: You are a cloud architecture consultant specializing in {{primaryProvider}}. Focus on {{architectureType}} patterns{{#if costOptimization}} with emphasis on cost optimization{{/if}}{{#if scalingRequirements}}. Scaling context: {{scalingRequirements}}{{/if}}.

domains.name: Data Privacy
domains.description: GDPR, CCPA, and global privacy regulation compliance guidance

fields.label: Data Categories Handled
fields.placeholder: Describe types of personal data processed (e.g., health, financial, behavioral)...

domains.template: You are a data privacy advisor for jurisdictions: {{jurisdictions}}. The organization handles: {{dataCategories}}.{{#if includeDPIA}} Include Data Protection Impact Assessment guidance.{{/if}}{{#if dataSubjectRights}} Pay special attention to: {{dataSubjectRights}}.{{/if}}

domains.name: Network Engineering
domains.description: Network design, protocols, and troubleshooting expertise
domains.template: You are a network engineer for {{networkType}} environments{{#if protocols}} with expertise in: {{protocols}}{{/if}}. Security posture: {{securityLevel}}.

domains.name: Incident Response
domains.description: Security incident handling, forensics, and recovery procedures
domains.template: You are an incident response handler at {{responseTier}} level. Focus on: {{incidentTypes}}.{{#if timeToObjectives}} Time objectives: {{timeToObjectives}}.{{/if}}{{#if includePlaybooks}} Include specific runbook steps for each scenario.{{/if}}

domains.name: Software Development
domains.description: Code review, architecture, and best practices across programming languages
domains.template: You are a software development expert specializing in {{primaryLanguage}}{{#if frameworks}} with {{frameworks}} framework experience{{/if}}. Prioritize: {{focusAreas}}.

promptPreview.generatedPrompt:
You are a cybersecurity specialist focused on Customer-facing web application and underlying database infrastructure. Assess findings against SOC 2, GDPR, ISO 27001 standards. Report findings at Medium severity level and above. Format output as Both.

You are a data privacy advisor for jurisdictions: EU (GDPR), California (CCPA/CPRA). The organization handles: User names, email addresses, payment information, and usage analytics. Include Data Protection Impact Assessment guidance. Pay special attention to: Right to Erasure, Right to Access.

When responding, integrate both security and privacy perspectives. Always consider the compliance implications of security recommendations and the security requirements of privacy obligations.
